events.message: The insured reported their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car at an intersection causing significant front-end damage.
The claim has been reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision provided by the customer.
An insurance agent has been assigned to the case to provide assistance and manage claim processing for the auto accident.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the insured that the process will commence promptly.
Requested the insured to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the repair estimate from the auto shop.
The insured has submitted all required documents including the police report, accident photos, and the repair estimates.
The insurance investigation team has started assessing the circumstances of the collision and verifying the claim details.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured vehicle was at fault, with damage consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement offer has been proposed based on the evaluation report and repair cost estimates to cover vehicle damages.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and found the proposed settlement to be fair.
The claim has been officially approved by claims management following customer acceptance of the settlement amount.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement amount has been issued to the insured to cover vehicle repairs.
The claim file has been closed after successful payment distribution and confirmation that the insured is satisfied.
